title: What is the concept of the "Ego" and how does it limit our potential as human beings?
first_phrase: This text explores the idea that in extreme cases, we reduce people to their monetary value or their usefulness, making them mere objects, when in reality, every person is much more than that. It cites various sources and concepts, including alchemy, the four temperaments, and the importance of staying present in oneself and adaptable to changing circumstances. The last part (200 tokens) includes thoughts on health, wealth, and happiness, urging readers to find their optimal level of economic comfort and to pursue pleasure in non-monetary forms.

last_phrase: In conclusion, by recognizing and expanding our consciousness beyond the limitations of our ego, we can access a new level of experiencing the world, where time is transcended, and coincidences happen. Our reality is not only created by external factors but also by our own perception and observation. The ancient wisdom has already revealed the unification of different principles, the passive 'self,' the neutral physical body, and the consciousness, as the key to transcendence. Through this, we can access a new depth of the present moment, where we can create our own reality and experience the true potential of our being.
